function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"The app may not accurately determine whether an individual has been exposed to a potential COVID-19 patient, leading to false alerts or a lack of necessary alerts","Impact":"Failure to identify potential exposures could result in the spread of COVID-19 and put individuals at risk","Mitigation":"Regular testing and verification of exposure events, along with transparent communication about the app's limitations","Technologies":"Improved GPS and Bluetooth tracking technology, along with enhanced data analytics for exposure notification","People":"Indian citizens using the Aarogya Setu app","Owner":"National Informatics Centre, Ministry of Electronics and IT (MeitY)"},{"Description":"Privacy concerns surrounding the use of GPS technology could lead to public distrust and reluctance to use the app","Impact":"Reduced adoption and effectiveness of the app in mitigating the spread of COVID-19","Mitigation":"Transparent communication about data privacy measures, independent audits of the app's data handling practices, and clear opt-in/opt-out mechanisms for data sharing","Technologies":"Encryption and anonymization of location data, as well as secure data storage protocols","People":"Indian citizens using the Aarogya Setu app","Owner":"National Informatics Centre, Ministry of Electronics and IT (MeitY)"},{"Description":"Rapid and widespread adoption of the app without adequate understanding of its limitations and capabilities","Impact":"Misinterpretation of alerts, confusion, and misinformed decision-making by app users","Mitigation":"Comprehensive educational campaigns to inform the public about the app's functionalities, limitations, and appropriate responses to alerts","Technologies":"Public information campaigns using various communication channels, including social media and traditional media","People":"Indian citizens using the Aarogya Setu app","Owner":"National Informatics Centre, Ministry of Electronics and IT (MeitY)"}]}
